title: At-rules
summary: At-rules are CSS statements that instruct CSS how to behave. They begin with an at sign, '@' (U+0040 COMMERCIAL AT), followed by an identifier and includes everything up to the next semicolon, ';' (U+003B SEMICOLON), or the next CSS block, whichever comes first.
pageTitle: At-rules - CSS: Cascading Style Sheets | MDN
